Episodes.Title: New Earth
Episodes.Plot:
Location: New Earth
Date: 5,000,000,023 
Enemies: Lady Cassandra, The Flesh, Sisters of Plenitude 

In the year five billion and twenty-three, after the destruction of the Earth, the Doctor takes Rose to the New Earth. There, in a hospital facility, the feline Sisters of Plenitude can mysteriously cure any diseases, but, in the basement, an old enemy of the Doctor is out for revenge.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Adjoa Andoh, Camille Coduri, Noel Clarke, Simon Ludders, Doña Croll, Lucy Robinson, Struan Rodger, Zoë Wanamaker, Sean Gallagher, Anna Hope

Episodes.Title: Tooth and Claw
Episodes.Plot:
Location: Torchwood House, Scotland, Earth Date: 1879 
Enemies: Werewolf, The Monks

Landing in 1879, Scotland, the Tenth Doctor and Rose meet Queen Victoria, travelling with her to spend the night at the Torchwood Estate. However, a group of warrior monks have sinister plans for the monarch, and the full moon is about to summon a creature out of legend.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Ruthie Milne, Spencer Hawken, Ron Donachie, Pauline Collins, Ian Hanmore, Derek Riddell, Michelle Duncan, Jamie Sives, Tom Rob Smith

Episodes.Title: School Reunion
Episodes.Plot:
Location: Deffry Vale High School, London, England, Earth 
Date: 2007 
Enemies: The Krillitanes 

There are strange goings-on at a comprehensive school - UFOs, over-intelligent children, and odd-tasting school dinners. This attracts the attention of the Tenth Doctor, Rose and Mickey Smith, as well as a couple of old friends?
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Noel Clarke, Elisabeth Sladen, John Leeson, Eugene Washington, Caroline Berry, Rod Arthur, Clem Tibber, Benjamin Smith, Anthony Stewart Head, Heather Cameron, Lucinda Dryzek, Joe Pickley

Episodes.Title: The Girl in the Fireplace
Episodes.Plot:
Location: Versailles, France, Earth and on S.S. Madame de Pompadour (a Spaceship)
Date: Across the 18th Century and during the 51st Century
Enemies: Clockwork Droids

On a seemingly abandoned spaceship in the 51st century, the Tenth Doctor, Rose and Mickey find time windows leading to 18th century France and a group of clockwork androids using them to stalk a young woman throughout her life.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Paul Kasey, Jonathan Hart, Jessica Atkins, Emily Joyce, Ellen Thomas, Gareth Wyn Griffiths, Noel Clarke, Ben Turner, Sophia Myles, Angel Coulby

Episodes.Title: Rise of the Cybermen (1)
Episodes.Plot:
Location: Parallel Earth
Date: 1st February, 2007
Enemy: John Lumic, The Cybermen

After the TARDIS makes a crash landing on the Earth of another universe, Rose discovers her father is alive and rich, Mickey encounters his alternative self, and the Tenth Doctor learns one of his oldest and deadliest foes is about to be reborn.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Camille Coduri, Noel Clarke, Nicholas Briggs, Paul Kasey, Shaun Dingwall, Andrew Hayden Smith, Roger Lloyd-Pack, Mona Hammond, Helen Griffin, Colin Spaull, Duncan Duff, Paul Antony-Barber, Adam Shaw, Andrew Ufondo

Episodes.Title: The Age of Steel (2)
Episodes.Plot:
Location: A parallel Earth
Date: 1st/2nd February, 2007
Enemy: John Lumic, Cyber-Controller, The Cybermen

The plans of John Lumic to convert the world into Cybermen are now in full force. The Tenth Doctor, Rose, Mickey and the Preachers must find a way to stop him from enforcing his "ultimate upgrade."
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Camille Coduri, Noel Clarke, Paul Kasey, Nicholas Briggs, Shaun Dingwall, Don Warrington, Jules Bert, Andrew Hayden Smith, Duncan Duff, Helen Griffin, Roger Lloyd-Pack, Colin Spaull

Episodes.Title: The Idiot's Lantern
Episodes.Plot:
Location: London, England, Earth
Date: 1953 - Queen Elizabeth II's Coronation Enemy: The Wire 

In 1953 London, the police are abducting people from their homes. The people of Britain gather around their new-fangled "tele-vision" sets to celebrate the new Queen's coronation - but something strange is affecting the signal.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Jamie Foreman, Ieuan Rhys, Margaret John, Rory Jennings, Ron Cook, Jean Challis, Sam Cox, Christopher Driscoll, Marie Lewis, Maureen Lipman, Debra Gillett

Episodes.Title: The Impossible Planet (1)
Episodes.Plot:
Location: In orbit below a black hole
Date: Possibly 43,000 (43K reference)
Enemy: The Beast,The Ood (as The Legion of The Beast)

Rose finds herself further away from home than ever before, on a desolate world in the orbit of a Black Hole. Trapped with an Earth expedition and the mysterious Ood, the time-travellers face an even greater danger as something ancient beneath the planet's surface begins to awake.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Paul Kasey, Shaun Parkes, Gabriel Woolf, Ronny Jhutti, Claire Rushbrook, Myanna Buring, Danny Webb, Will Thorp, Silas Carson

Episodes.Title: The Satan Pit (2)
Episodes.Plot:
Location: In orbit below a black hole
Date: Possibly 43,000 (43K reference)
Enemy: The Beast,The Ood (as The Legion of The Beast)

The TARDIS lands in a base on a planet orbiting a black hole, an impossible situation that stumps even the Tenth Doctor. The base crew are drilling to the centre of the world, to claim the power that keeps it in orbit for themselves. However, an ancient evil is down there too, and he is awake?
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Paul Kasey, Silas Carson, Gabriel Woolf, Danny Webb, Shaun Parkes, Claire Rushbrook, Will Thorp, Ronny Jhutti

Episodes.Title: Love and Monsters
Episodes.Plot:
Location: London, Earth
Date: 2007
Enemy: The Abzorbaloff 

An ordinary man named Elton Pope becomes obsessed with the Tenth Doctor, Rose and their strange blue box, joining a group of like-minded people in hopes of finding him. But when the mysterious Victor Kennedy joins the group, the fun soon stops and Elton discovers a darker side to his hobby.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: PG Some scenes may scare very young children
Episodes.GuestStars: Camille Coduri, Paul Kasey, Marc Warren, Shirley Henderson, Peter Kay, Moya Brady, Bella Emberg, Simon Greenall, Kathryn Drysdale

Episodes.Title: Fear Her
Episodes.Plot:
Location: Earth
Date: 2012
Enemy: Chloe Webber/Isolas

When the TARDIS lands in 2012, the Tenth Doctor plans to show Rose the London Olympics. However, ordinary children are vanishing into thin air, a mother living in a seemingly normal British household is trying to hide her daughter's unnatural powers from the world, and a demonic presence lurks in an upstairs cupboard.
Episodes.GuestStars: Nina Sosanya, Abisola Agbaje, Abdul Salis, Tim Faraday, Erica Eirian, Edna Doré, Alistair Appleton, Christopher Driscoll, Richard Nichols, Stephen Marzella

Episodes.Title: Army of Ghosts (1)
Episodes.Plot:
Location: London, Torchwood Tower
Date: 2007
Enemies: Cybermen, Torchwood

Ghostly beings have been regularly appearing across the world and people, believing them to be their dead loved ones, are welcoming their visits with open arms. When the TARDIS arrives at the Torchwood Institute, the Tenth Doctor and Rose are taken prisoner. They are drawn into the investigation of a mysterious sphere kept in Torchwood Tower, and monstrous foes return as two universes collide.
Episodes.GuestStars: Paul Kasey, David Hankinson, Barnaby Edwards, Nicholas Pegg, Nicholas Briggs, Camille Coduri, Noel Clarke, Derek Acorah, Raji James, Hajaz Akram, Anthony de Baeck, Takako Akashi, Paul Fields, Maddi Cryer, Stuart C

Episodes.Title: Doomsday (2)
Episodes.Plot:
Location: London, Torchwood Tower
Date: 2007
Enemies: Cybermen, Daleks

Humanity is caught in the crossfire as the Cybermen and the Daleks wage war against each other. When the mysterious Genesis Ark opens, the Tenth Doctor is faced with an impossible decision: saving the world could mean losing Rose Tyler forever?
Episodes.GuestStars: Noel Clarke, Nicholas Briggs, Camille Coduri, Barnaby Edwards, Paul Kasey, Andrew Hayden Smith, Raji James, Tracy-Ann Oberman, Shaun Dingwall

Episodes.Title: The Runaway Bride
Episodes.Plot: A bride mysteriously vanishes as she prepares to marry her boyfriend.
